pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:0.5_0: The training rule on lying down on the tongue
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate sticking out their tongues. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not eat sticking out my tongue,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.4_0: he should not eat sticking out his tongue;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats sticking out his tongue, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.9_0: The ninth rule, the training rule on nine, is finished.
